intro: Agrostemma gracile var. thessalum, commonly known as the Thessalian slenderweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
